TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He is represented before the Court by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The NORP Government ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr J. GPE , succeeded by Ms J. Chrzanowska , of ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE ORG in PERSON instituted proceedings with a view to making the applicant ’s father PERSON undergo treatment for alcoholism . They referred to numerous police interventions at the family apartment as a result of PERSON ’s repeated acts of aggression and violence against his family and to a diagnosis made by a psychiatrist to the effect that he suffered from alcoholism .
CARDINAL . He apparently failed to comply with that order .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the police of acts of domestic violence committed by his father .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s mother lodged an action for separation with the Bielsko - Biala Regional Court .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bill of indictment against PERSON on charges of domestic violence was lodged with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Bielsko - Biala Regional Court allowed the applicant ’s mother ’s separation claim . In its judgment the court established that the applicant ’s mother and father were to use separate parts of the family house .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant ’s father of domestic violence ( znęcanie sie nad osobą najbliższą ) . The applicant ’s father submitted himself to the sentence ( dobrowolne poddanie sie karze ) . The court sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and conditionally stayed the execution of that sentence for a probation period of DATE . The court also obliged him to abstain from alcohol abuse and assigned a probation officer to supervise his conduct .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , his mother and younger brother requested the court to lift the stay of the execution of the prison sentence . They submitted that PERSON continued to drink and that his behaviour remained violent .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held the first hearing in the case . It heard evidence from the applicant , his mother , his brother , the probation officer and CARDINAL other persons . It had regard to the police records and to the probation officer ’s file . It found that the applicant ’s father had continued to be violent , had battered his wife , proffered insults and humiliated his sons and had abused alcohol .
CARDINAL . The next hearing was held on DATE . The court heard evidence from the applicant ’s younger brother and ordered that an expert report on PERSON ’s mental health be prepared .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave a decision . It noted that the applicant ’s mother had declared that her husband ’s behaviour had slightly improved and that therefore there were grounds for accepting that he was capable of mending his ways . The court was of the view that in these circumstances it would not be justified to order the prison sentence to be executed . However , it ordered the defendant to leave the family apartment within DATE , referring to LAW ) ( b ) of LAW . It observed that this obligation could be imposed on a defendant regardless of his ownership of the apartment and that it only limited him in the exercise of the right to live here , his ownership rights remaining intact .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s father appealed against this decision . He requested that the obligation to leave the house be lifted . A hearing before the appellate court was scheduled for DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the probation officer contacted the applicant and his mother on the one hand and PERSON on the other within the framework of the supervision of the execution of the judgment given on CARDINAL DATE on the following dates : CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE and QUANTITY DATE , CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant wrote to the probation officer and complained that his father continued to be violent .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bielsko - Biala Regional Court upheld the decision of CARDINAL DATE . It therefore became final on that date and PERSON was obliged to leave the house by CARDINAL DATE .
He failed to do so .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified later date the applicant requested the assistance of a local bailiff . In reply , he was informed orally that it was legally impossible for the bailiff to take any enforcement steps if the person ordered to leave the apartment refused to do so .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the probation officer requested ORG to take steps in order to have the decision of CARDINAL DATE executed , referring to PERSON ’s failure to move out .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE PERSON informed the court that he had been trying to find a new apartment , but that he had not found one so far . The court adjourned the examination of the case until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in a civil case for the division of marital property , the applicant ’s parents concluded a settlement on the basis of which PERSON was obliged to move out of the family house within DATE from that date . This settlement became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . During the hearing held on DATE ORG was informed of the settlement concluded on DATE . It adjourned the proceedings until DATE in order to read the casefile .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG noted that the applicant ’s father had moved out of the house on DATE . It therefore decided not to order the enforcement of the prison sentence and obliged PERSON not to approach the applicant and his mother .
CARDINAL . DATE of the Law on Domestic Violence ( LOC o przeciwdziałaniu przemocy w rodzinie ) was adopted on DATE . It amended LAW by adding to it the following text :
When staying execution of a sentence , the court may impose on a defendant an obligation to : ( ... )
CARDINAL . ( b ) leave an apartment where the defendant lives with the victim [ of the offence concerned ] .

CARDINAL . In its ORG ( CARDINAL of DATE on the protection of women against violence , ORG stated , inter alia , that member GPE should introduce , develop and/or improve where necessary national policies against violence based on maximum safety and protection of victims , support and assistance , adjustment of the criminal and civil law , raising of public awareness , training for professionals confronted with violence against women and prevention .

CARDINAL . With regard to violence within the family , ORG recommended that member States should classify all forms of violence within the family as criminal offences and envisage the possibility of taking measures in order , inter alia , to enable the judiciary to adopt interim measures aimed at protecting victims , to ban the perpetrator from contacting , communicating with or approaching the victim , or residing in or entering defined areas , to penalise all breaches of the measures imposed on the perpetrator and to establish a compulsory protocol for operation by the police , medical and social services .
